author: wsjcom
title: Judaism’s Uniqueness Is Necessary for It to Survive
text: Bravo to Journal Critic at Large Edward Rothstein for his devastating review (“A People’s History Exiled,” Life & Arts, Jan. 23) excoriating the new presentation by New York’s Jewish Museum of its collection. The American Jewish community is in the midst of a titanic struggle between two self-perspectives. One perspective sees and celebrates moments and achievements of survival and continuity against an oceanic tide of assimilation. The other abandons the unique in Judaism, in favor of the identification of the “Jewish version” of various universalist virtues and impulses. The Jewish Museum has abandoned Column A...
